ARABIC: إِنِّى وَجَّهْتُ وَجْهِىَ لِلَّذِى فَطَرَ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضَ حَنِيفًا وَمَآ أَنَا۠ مِنَ ٱلْمُشْرِكِينَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: I have turned my face to Him Who brought the heavens and earth into being, a pure natural believer. I am not one of the mushrikun.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: I have truly turned my face towards Him who created the heavens and the earth: I have chosen one way and am not an idolater."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Behold, I have turned my face in exclusive devotion to the One Who originated the heavens and the earth, and I am certainly not one of those who associate others with Allah in His divinity.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: I have up-rightly submitted myself to the One who has created the heavens and the earth and I am not an idol worshipper."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: “I have directed my attention towards Him Who has created the heavens and the earth, am devoted solely to Him, and am not of the polytheists.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Verily, I have turned my face towards Him Who has created the heavens and the earth, Hanifan, and I am not of the idolators."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Surely I have turned myself, being upright, wholly to Him Who originated the heavens and the earth, and I am not of the polytheists.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: I have turned my face to Him who originated the heavens and the earth, a man of pure faith; I am not of the idolaters.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Lo! I have turned my face toward Him Who created the heavens and the earth, as one by nature upright, and I am not of the idolaters.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: I have set my face with single-minded devotion, towards Him who has created the heavens and the earth, and I am not one of the polytheists."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Verily I have set my countenance towards Him who hath created the heavens and the earth, upright, and am not of the associaters.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: ‘Indeed I have turned my face toward Him who originated the heavens and the earth, as a Hanif, and I am not one of the polytheists.’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: For me, I have set my face, firmly and truly, towards Him Who created the heavens and the earth, and never shall I give partners to Allah."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Verily, I have turned my face towards Him Who has created the heavens and the earth Hanifa (Islamic Monotheism, i.e. worshipping none but Allah Alone) and I am not of Al-Mushrikun (see V. 2:105)".
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: I have turned my face to Him who has created the heavens and the earth, uprightly, and I am not among the idolaters'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: I have directed my attention towards Him Who created the heavens and the earth—a monotheist—and I am not of the idolaters.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Indeed, I have turned my face toward He who created the heavens and the earth, inclining toward truth, and I am not of those who associate others with Allah."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [6:79] He said: Verily I have turned my face to, I am seeking in worship, Him Who originated, created, the heavens and the earth, namely, God; a hanīf, inclining towards the upright religion, and I am not of those that associate others’, with Him.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: When they asked him: who do you worship? He said: (Lo! I have turned my face towards) I have made my religion and works sincere to (him Who created the heavens and the earth, as one by nature upright) Muslim, (and I am not of the idolaters) who follows their religion.
